Race.SpecificTitle: City Judge -- City Court, City of Zachary
Chief of Police -- City of Zachary
Parishwide Law Enforcement District -- 6.90 Mills Renewal - Sheriff - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Law Enforcement District of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt a resolution providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of six and ninety hundredths (6.90) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation of all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana (the "Tax") (an estimated $35,138,325 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2024, and annually thereafter to and including the year 2033, with the proceeds of said Tax to be used for operational purposes of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 -- 4.00 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect an ad valorem tax of 4.00 mills ("the Tax") in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2023 to and including the year 2032 (an estimated $4,000,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases), and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities, equipment and personnel of the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 within St. George Fire Protection District No. 2?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sherwood Forest Crime Prev. & Nbrhd. Imp. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sherwood Forest Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Sherwood Forest Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a parcel fee on each improved and unimproved parcel within the District for a period of ten years, beginning in 2024 and ending in 2033, in the amount of $100 for the first five years which may be increased up to an additional $100 after 2028 all as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.19, with the proceeds of said parcel fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of District residents by providing for an increase in the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District and to serve the needs of the residents of the District by funding beautification and improvements for the overall betterment of the District (an estimated $304,200 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sagefield Crime Prevent. and Imp. Dist. -- $120 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Sagefield Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Sagefield Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District") be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee of $120 on each improved and unimproved parcel within the District for a period of 10 years, beginning in 2023 and ending in 2032, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be used to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of the District's residents by providing for an increase in the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District and to add to the overall betterment of the District by providing for beautification and other improvements within the District (an estimated $19,200.00 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Park Forest Crime Prevention and Improvement Dist. -- $75.00 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Park Forest Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Park Forest Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District"), be authorized to renew the annual parcel fee within the District for a period of 10 years, beginning in 2024 and ending in 2033, of $75.00 for each developed lot upon which is situated a single-family residence and be authorized to increase the parcel fee once, not less than five years after approval of the parcel fee, provided the amount of the increased parcel fee does not exceed $200 per parcel as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.14, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be used to promote and encourage beautification, security and overall betterment of the District (an estimated $121,350.00 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Melrose East Crime Prevention District -- $200 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Melrose East Crime Prevention District Proposition
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Melrose East Crime Prevention District ("District") be authorized to renew its annual parcel fee of up to $200 per improved residential parcel and an initial parcel fee of up to $500 per improved commercial parcel located in the District for a period of 10 years, beginning in 2023 and ending in 2032, to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of District residents by increasing the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District and for all purposes set forth in La. R.S. 33:9097.7 and be authorized to increase the initial parcel fee on improved commercial parcels by not more than 5% per year (an estimated $75,100 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Old Jefferson Crime Prevent. and Imp. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Old Jefferson Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Old Jefferson Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District"), be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee on each improved and unimproved parcel located within the District for a period of 10 years, beginning in 2023 and ending in 2032, with an initial fee of $100 per parcel and shall the District be authorized to increase the parcel fee one time each subsequent calendar year by an amount not to exceed 5% of the amount of the fee imposed the previous calendar year provided the fee shall not exceed $150 and the parcel fee for owners of lots granted the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VI, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana shall be 50% of the parcel fee levied and collected on other lots, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be used to aid in crime prevention, to enhance security, to provide for an increase in security patrols and to provide for the overall betterment of the District and for the purposes provided by Act 106 (2022) (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy is $79,750.00)?
